1042.12 MAINTENANCE OF PRIVATE SEWERS; NUISANCES.
   (a)   As used in this section:
      (1)   "Sewer" means a storm and/or a sanitary sewer.
      (2)   "Private sewer" means a sewer that is constructed with or without a
permit and paid for by a private person.
   (b)   All private sewers located on private property are the sole
responsibility of the property owner and shall be maintained by such owner.
   (c)   Nothing in this section is intended to waive, alter or eliminate, in
any way, the rights of the City to eliminate any nuisance that may occur on
private property, as that right is allowed to the City by the laws of the State
or the ordinances of the City, including, but not limited to, the rights of the
City set forth in Sections
660.18,
660.20 and
1042.06 of these Codified Ordinances.
(Ord. 57-83. Passed 6-27-83.)
1042.121 CITY’S EXPENSES TO BE REIMBURSED.
   Where public sewers have been constructed, and the cost thereof has been
wholly or partially paid out of funds of the City or financed through the
issuance of bonds, and the owner of any property abutting upon or in proximity
to such sewers makes application to tap into such sewers, no permit shall be
issued to such property owner to make such connection or connections, nor shall
such property owner make such connection or connections, unless he has first
paid into the City Treasury, or given security for such payment satisfactory to
the fiscal officer of the City, that portion of the cost of such sewers for
which a connection or connections are desired to be made which was paid by the
City or was considered to be charged in the form of an assessment, but which
charge or assessment the City has determined not to collect for any reason,
including but not limited to a determination of lack of benefit to the
property. Council may approve such other tap in restrictions on such properties
as Council may determine to be fair and reasonable.
(Ord. 68-2009. Passed 9-22-09.)
1042.13 RESPONSIBILITY OF DEVELOPERS TO NOTIFY CITY OF TRANSFER OF POSSESSION
OF DWELLINGS; SEWAGE CHARGES.
   (a)   Developers of new residential structures in the City shall notify the
Department of Finance, in writing, within ninety days after possession of any
new residential structure in the City has transferred from the developer to the
new owner so as to put the City on notice that such possession has taken place.
   (b)   The failure of a developer to so notify the City in a timely fashion
as set forth herein, in writing, shall cause any and all delinquent sewage
charges billed by the City, for any particular property where possession has
transferred, to be paid by and due from any such developer, together with
penalties and interest thereon as provided by the ordinances of the City. Such
charges, together with penalties and interest if any, shall be due from the
developer only after the expiration of the ninety-day period and shall continue
to be the liability of the developer until proper notification is made to the
City, by the developer, as provided herein.
   (c)   The City may withhold the payment of any such charges, together with
penalty and interest, due from the developer, from the developer's deposits
provided for in Chapter
1452 of these Codified Ordinances.
(Ord. 103-89. Passed 12-12-89.)
1042.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates or fails to comply with any of the provisions of this
chapter shall be fined not more than one hundred dollars ($100.00). A separate
offense shall be deemed committed each day during or on which a violation
occurs or continues.
 CHAPTER 1043
Illicit Discharge and Illegal Connection Control
1043.01   Purpose and scope.
1043.02   Applicability.
1043.03   Definitions.
1043.04   Disclaimer of liability.
1043.05   Conflicts, severability, nuisances and responsibility.
1043.06   Responsibility for administration.
1043.07   Discharge and connection prohibitions.
1043.08   Monitoring of illicit discharges and illegal connections.
1043.09   Enforcement.
1043.10   Remedies not exclusive.
1043.99   Penalty.
1043.01 PURPOSE AND SCOPE.
   The purpose of this regulation is to provide for the health, safety, and
general welfare of the citizens of the City of Olmsted Falls through the
regulation of illicit discharges to the municipal separate storm sewer system
(MS4). This chapter establishes methods for controlling the introduction of
pollutants into the MS4 in order to comply with requirements of the National
Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) permit process as required by
the Ohio Environmental Protection Agency (Ohio EPA). The objectives of this
regulation are:
   (a)   To prohibit illicit discharges and illegal connections to the MS4.
   (b)   To establish legal authority to carry out inspections, monitoring
procedures, and enforcement actions necessary to ensure compliance with this
regulation.
      (Ord. 22-2010. Passed 3-9-10.)
1043.02 APPLICABILITY.
   This chapter shall apply to all residential, commercial, industrial or
institutional facilities responsible for discharges to the MS4 and on any lands
in the City of Olmsted Falls, except for those discharges generated by the
activities detailed in Section
1043.07(a)(1) to (a)(3) of this regulation.
(Ord. 22-2010. Passed 3-9-10.)
1043.03 DEFINITIONS.
   The words and terms used in this chapter, unless otherwise expressly stated,
shall have the following meaning:
   (a)   Best Management Practices (BMPs): means schedules of activities,
prohibitions of practices, general good housekeeping practices, pollution
prevention and educational practices, maintenance procedures, and other
management practices to prevent or reduce the discharge of pollutants to storm
water. BMPs also include treatment practices, operating procedures, and
practices to control site runoff, spillage or leaks, sludge or water disposal,
or drainage from raw materials storage.
   (b)   Community: means the City of Olmsted Falls, its designated
representatives, boards, or commissions.
   (c)   Environmental Protection Agency or United States Environmental
Protection Agency (USEPA): means the United States Environmental Protection
Agency, including but not limited to the Ohio Environmental Protection Agency
(Ohio EPA), or any duly authorized official of said agency.
   (d)   Floatable Material: in general this term means any foreign matter that
may float or remain suspended in the water column, and includes but is not
limited to, plastic, aluminum cans, wood products, bottles, and paper products.
   (e)   Hazardous Material: means any material including any substance, waste,
or combination thereof, which because of its quantity, concentration, or
physical, chemical, or infectious characteristics may cause, or significantly
contribute to, a substantial present or potential hazard to human health,
safety, property, or the environment when improperly treated, stored,
transported, disposed of, or otherwise managed.
   (f)   Illicit Discharge: as defined at 40 C.F.R. 122.26 (b)(2) means any
discharge to an MS4 that is not composed entirely of storm water, except for
those discharges to an MS4 pursuant to a NPDES permit or noted in Section
1043.07.
   (g)   Illegal Connection: means any drain or conveyance, whether on the
surface or subsurface, that allows an illicit discharge to enter the MS4.
   (h)   Municipal Separate Storm Sewer System (MS4): as defined at 40 C.F.R.
122.26 (b)(8), municipal separate storm sewer system means a conveyance or
system of conveyances (including roads with drainage systems, municipal
streets, catch basins, curbs, gutters, ditches, man-made channels, or storm
drains):
      (1)   Owned or operated by a State, city, town, borough, county, parish,
district, municipality, township, county, district, association, or other
public body (created by or pursuant to State law) having jurisdiction over
sewage, industrial wastes, including special districts under State law such as
a sewer district, or similar entity, or an Indian tribe or an authorized Indian
tribal organization, or a designated and approved management agency under
section 208 of the Clean Water Act that discharges to waters of the United
States;
      (2)   Designed or used for collecting or conveying storm water;
      (3)   Which is not a combined sewer; and
      (4)   Which is not part of a Publicly Owned Treatment Works (POTW) as
defined at 40 C.F.R. 122.2.
   (i)   National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) Storm Water
Discharge Permit: means a permit issued by EPA (or by a State under authority
delegated pursuant to 33 USC § 1342(b)) that authorizes the discharge of
pollutants to waters of the United States, whether the permit is applicable on
an individual, group, or general areawide basis.
   (j)   Off-Lot Discharging Home Sewage Treatment System: means a system
designed to treat home sewage on-site and discharges treated wastewater
effluent off the property into a storm water or surface water conveyance or
system.
   (k)   Owner/Operator: means any individual, association, organization,
partnership, firm, corporation or other entity recognized by law and acting as
either the owner or on the owner's behalf.
   (l)   Pollutant: means anything that causes or contributes to pollution.
Pollutants may include, but are not limited to, paints, varnishes, solvents,
oil and other automotive fluids, non-hazardous liquid and solid wastes, yard
wastes, refuse, rubbish, garbage, litter or other discarded or abandoned
objects, floatable materials, pesticides, herbicides, fertilizers, hazardous
materials, wastes, sewage, dissolved and particulate metals, animal wastes,
residues that result from constructing a structure, and noxious or offensive
matter of any kind.
   (m)   Storm Water: any surface flow, runoff, and drainage consisting
entirely of water from any form of natural precipitation, and resulting from
such precipitation.
   (n)   Wastewater: means the spent water of a community. From the standpoint
of a source, it may be a combination of the liquid and water-carried wastes
from residences, commercial buildings, industrial plants, and institutions.
      (Ord. 22-2010. Passed 3-9-10.)
1043.04 DISCLAIMER OF LIABILITY.
   Compliance with the provisions of this chapter shall not relieve any person
from responsibility for damage to any person otherwise imposed by law. The
provisions of this chapter are promulgated to promote the health, safety, and
welfare of the public and are not designed for the benefit of any individual or
for the benefit of any particular parcel of property. (Ord. 22-2010. Passed 3-
9-10.)
1043.05 CONFLICTS, SEVERABILITY, NUISANCES AND RESPONSIBILITY.
   (a)   Where this chapter is in conflict with other provisions of law or
ordinance, the most restrictive provisions, as determined by the City of
Olmsted Falls, shall prevail.
   (b)   If any clause, section, or provision of this chapter is declared
invalid or unconstitutional by a court of competent jurisdiction, the validity
of the remainder shall not be affected thereby.
   (c)   This chapter shall not be construed as authorizing any person to
maintain a nuisance on their property, and compliance with the provisions of
this chapter shall not be a defense in any action to abate such a nuisance.
   (d)   Failure of the City of Olmsted Falls to observe or recognize hazardous
or unsightly conditions or to recommend corrective measures shall not relieve
the site owner from the responsibility for the condition or damage resulting
there from, and shall not result in the City of Olmsted Falls, its officers,
employees, or agents being responsible for any condition or damage resulting
there from.
(Ord. 22-2010. Passed 3-9-10.)
1043.06 RESPONSIBILITY FOR ADMINISTRATION.
   The City of Olmsted Falls shall administer, implement, and enforce the
provisions of this chapter. The City of Olmsted Falls may contract with the
Cuyahoga County Board of Health to conduct inspections and monitoring and to
assist with enforcement actions.
(Ord. 22-2010. Passed 3-9-10.)
1043.07 DISCHARGE AND CONNECTION PROHIBITIONS.
   (a)   Prohibition of Illicit Discharges. No person shall discharge, or cause
to be discharged, an illicit discharge into the MS4. The commencement, conduct,
or continuance of any illicit discharge to the MS4 is prohibited except as
described below:
      (1)   Water line flushing; landscape irrigation; diverted stream flows;
rising ground waters; uncontaminated ground water infiltration; uncontaminated
pumped ground water; discharges from potable water sources; foundation drains;
air conditioning condensate; irrigation water; springs; water from crawl space
pumps; footing drains; lawn watering; individual residential car washing; flows
from riparian habitats and wetlands; dechlorinated swimming pool discharges;
street wash water; and discharges or flows from fire fighting activities. These
discharges are exempt until such time as they are determined by the City of
Olmsted Falls to be significant contributors of pollutants to the MS4.
      (2)   Discharges specified in writing by the City of Olmsted Falls as
being necessary to protect public health and safety.
      (3)   Discharges from off-lot discharging home sewage treatment systems
permitted by the Cuyahoga County Board of Health for the purpose of discharging
treated sewage effluent in accordance with Ohio Administrative Code 3701-29-02
(6) until such time as the Ohio Environmental Protection Agency issues an NPDES
permitting mechanism for residential 1, 2, or 3 family dwellings. These
discharges are exempt unless such discharges are deemed to be creating a public
health nuisance by the Cuyahoga County Board of Health.
In compliance with the City of Olmsted Falls Storm Water Management Program,
discharges from all off-lot discharging home sewage treatment systems must
either be eliminated or have coverage under an appropriate NPDES permit issued
and approved by the Ohio Environmental Protection Agency. When such permit
coverage is available, discharges from off-lot discharging home sewage
treatment systems will no longer be exempt from the requirements of this
chapter.
   (b)   Prohibition of Illegal Connections. The construction, use,
maintenance, or continued existence of illegal connections to the MS4 is
prohibited.
      (1)   This prohibition expressly includes, without limitation, illegal
connections made in the past, regardless of whether the connection was
permissible under law or practices applicable or prevailing at the time of
connection.
      (2)   A person is considered to be in violation of this chapter if the
person connects a line conveying illicit discharges to the MS4, or allows such
a connection to continue.
         (Ord. 22-2010. Passed 3-9-10.)
1043.08 MONITORING OF ILLICIT DISCHARGES AND ILLEGAL CONNECTIONS.
   (a)   Establishment of an Illicit Discharge and Illegal Connection
Monitoring Program: The City of Olmsted Falls shall establish a program to
detect and eliminate illicit discharges and illegal connections to the MS4.
This program shall include the mapping of the MS4, including MS4 outfalls and
home sewage treatment systems; the routine inspection of storm water outfalls
to the MS4, and the systematic investigation of potential residential,
commercial, and institutional facilities for the sources of any suspect dry
weather flows found as the result of these inspections.
   (b)   Inspection of Residential, Commercial, Industrial, or Institutional
Facilities.
      (1)   The City of Olmsted Falls shall be permitted to enter and inspect
facilities subject to this chapter as often as may be necessary to determine
compliance with this chapter.
      (2)   The City of Olmsted Falls shall have the right to set up at
facilities subject to this chapter such devices as are necessary to conduct
monitoring and/or sampling of the facility's storm water discharge, as
determined by the City of Olmsted Falls.
      (3)   Any temporary or permanent obstruction to safe and reasonable
access to the facility to be inspected and/or sampled shall be promptly removed
by the facility's owner/operator at the written or oral request of the City of
Olmsted Falls and shall not be replaced. The costs of clearing such access
shall be borne by the facility owner/operator.
      (4)   Unreasonable delays in allowing the City of Olmsted Falls access to
a facility subject to this chapter for the purposes of illicit discharge
inspection is a violation of this chapter.
      (5)   If the City of Olmsted Falls is refused access to any part of the
facility from which storm water is discharged, and the City of Olmsted Falls
demonstrates probable cause to believe that there may be a violation of this
chapter, or that there is a need to inspect and/or sample as part of an
inspection and sampling program designed to verify compliance with this chapter
or any order issued hereunder, or to protect the public health, safety, and
welfare, the City of Olmsted Falls may seek issuance of a search warrant, civil
remedies including but not limited to injunctive relief, and/or criminal
remedies from any court of appropriate jurisdiction.
      (6)   The City of Olmsted Falls reserves the right to assess fees for
negligence or undue costs due to non-cooperation from the property owner.
         (Ord. 22-2010. Passed 3-9-10.)
1043.09 ENFORCEMENT.
   (a)   Notice of Violation. When the City of Olmsted Falls finds that a
person has violated a prohibition or failed to meet a requirement of this
chapter, the City of Olmsted Falls may order compliance by written Notice of
Violation. Such notice must specify the violation and shall be hand delivered,
and/or sent by registered mail, to the owner/operator of the facility. Such
notice may require the following actions:
      (1)   The performance of monitoring, analyses, and reporting;
      (2)   The elimination of illicit discharges or illegal connections;
      (3)   That violating discharges, practices, or operations cease and
desist;
      (4)   The abatement or remediation of storm water pollution or
contamination hazards and the restoration of any affected property; or
      (5)   The implementation of source control or treatment BMPs.
   (b)   If abatement of a violation and/or restoration of affected property is
required, the Notice of Violation shall set forth a deadline within which such
remediation or restoration must be completed. Said Notice shall further advise
that, should the facility owner/operator fail to remediate or restore within
the established deadline, a legal action for enforcement may be initiated.
   (c)   Any person receiving a Notice of Violation must meet compliance
standards within the time established in the Notice of Violation.
   (d)   Hearing: If the violation has not been corrected pursuant to the
requirements set forth in the Notice of Violation, the City of Olmsted Falls
shall schedule a hearing by the Utilities Committee of Council to determine
reasons for non-compliance and to determine the next enforcement activity.
Notice of the hearing shall be hand delivered and/or sent registered mail.
   (e)   Injunctive Relief: It shall be unlawful for any owner/operator to
violate any provision or fail to comply with any of the requirements of this
chapter pursuant to O.R.C. 3709.211. If a owner/operator has violated or
continues to violate the provisions of this chapter, the City of Olmsted Falls
may petition for a preliminary or permanent injunction restraining the owner/
operator from activities that would create further violations or compelling the
owner/operator to perform abatement or remediation of the violation.
(Ord. 22-2010. Passed 3-9-10.)
1043.10 REMEDIES NOT EXCLUSIVE.
   The remedies listed in this chapter are not exclusive of any other remedies
available under any applicable federal, state or local law and it is in the
discretion of the City of Olmsted Falls to seek cumulative remedies.
(Ord. 22-2010. Passed 3-9-10.)
1043.99 PENALTY.
   (a)   Any person, firm, entity or corporation, including but not limited to,
the owner of the property, his agents and assigns, occupant, property manager,
and any contractor or subcontractor who violates or fails to comply with any
provision of this chapter, is guilty of a misdemeanor of the third degree and
shall be fined no more than five hundred dollars ($500.00) or imprisoned for no
more than sixty (60) days, or both, for each offense. A separate offense shall
be deemed committed each day during or on which a violation or noncompliance
occurs or continues.
   (b)   The imposition of any other penalties provided herein shall not
preclude the City of Olmsted Falls from instituting an appropriate action or
proceeding in a Court of proper jurisdiction to prevent an unlawful
development, or to restrain, correct, or abate a violation, or to require
compliance with the provisions of this chapter or other applicable laws,
ordinances, rules, or regulations, or the orders of the City of Olmsted Falls.
(Ord. 22-2010. Passed 3-9-10.)

1044.07   Faulty operation prohibited.

1044.09   Mandatory connection to sewers when available.
1044.10   License required.
1044.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to license sewer tappers and vault cleaners - see Ohio R.C. 715.27
Power to regulate water closets and privies - see Ohio R.C. 715.40
Compulsory sewer connections - see Ohio R.C. 729.06
Regulations to control house sewers and connections - see Ohio R.C. 729.51
Untreated sewage - see Ohio R. C. 3701.59
Sewage discharge into certain public places prohibited - see GEN. OFF.
660.04,
660.13 et seq.
Erosion and sediment control requirements - see P. & Z.
1214.01 et seq.
 
 
1044.01 PURPOSE.
   It is the intent of this chapter, for the health, safety and welfare of all
the residents of the City, to provide adequate controls for the proper
operation of mechanical waste water treatment plants to be hereafter
constructed within the City.
(W.V. Ord. 47-69. Passed 12-9-69.)
1044.02 PLANS AND SPECIFICATIONS; APPROVAL; CONTRACTS.
   No person seeking a building permit to construct any building, other than
single or two-family dwelling units or subdivisions within the City, when a
mechanical waste water treatment plant is to be constructed to service the
waste from such building, shall fail to:
   (a)   Obtain written approval of the plans, specifications and discharge
point from the Ohio Environmental Protection Agency;
   (b)   Place on file with the City Engineer a copy of the plans,
specifications and written approval of the Ohio Environmental Protection
Agency;
   (c)   Submit an executed copy of a contract, between the owner of the real
property upon which the building and waste water treatment plant is to be
constructed, and a licensed State waste water treatment plant operator,
providing for the perpetual maintenance and repair of such plant until its use
can be discontinued and connection is made to a sanitary sewerage system of the
City. The contract shall be binding upon heirs, administrators, executors and
assigns of the owner and shall be in a form approved by the Law Director;
   (d)   Enter into a contract with the City, providing for bimonthly
inspection of the waste water treatment plant by the City Engineer or other
inspector designated by Council for such purpose. The contract shall be in a
form approved by the Law Director. Inspection fees shall be provided therein,
which fees shall be paid annually in advance by the owner to the City.
      (W. V. Ord. 47-69. Passed 12-9-69.)
1044.03 ISSUANCE OF BUILDING PERMITS.
   No building permit shall be issued to construct any building referred to in
Section
1044.02 within the City until the applicant therefor has complied with such
section.
(W.V. Ord. 47-69. Passed 12-9-69.)
1044.04 CONTINUOUS INSPECTION.
   The application for a building permit shall be deemed to be a perpetual
license to the City, its agents, employees and delegates, to enter upon the
premises wherein the waste water treatment plant and its appurtenances are
located, for the purpose of inspecting the condition and operation of such
plant and to perform whatever tests are necessary to ascertain that the plant
is operating in accordance with standards established by the Ohio Environmental
Protection Agency, as amended from time to time.
(W.V. Ord. 47-69. Passed 12-9-69.)
1044.05 NOTICE, MAINTENANCE ORDERS AND CORRECTIVE ACTION.
   Upon inspection, if the inspector finds that the waste water treatment plant
is not being properly maintained, is in need of repair or is not operating in
accordance with the standards set forth in Section
1044.04, he shall forthwith serve a notice upon the owner by certified mail,
setting forth therein the maintenance to be performed or the repairs to be
made. A copy of such notice shall be sent to the Ohio Environmental Protection
Agency and to the person with whom the owner contracted for maintenance and
repair of such plant. The owner, within ten days of the date of the notice,
shall cause the specified maintenance or repairs to be performed.
(W.V. Ord. 47-69. Passed 12-9-69.)
1044.06 BOND REQUIRED.
   No permit to construct any building referred to in Section
1044.02 shall be issued until the applicant therefor has posted with the City a
cash bond in the amount of five hundred dollars ($500.00). This bond shall
remain on deposit with the City until the waste water treatment plant has been
discontinued and the sewer system serviced by such plant has been attached to
the sanitary sewerage system of the City.
   The applicant, in posting this bond, authorizes the inspector, in the event
that proper maintenance or repairs are not performed within ten days, after
notice as specified in Section
1044.05, to notify the maintenance firm, authorize maintenance or repairs, and
pay the cost of maintenance or repairs out of the cash bond on deposit. The
applicant shall thereafter re-establish the fund at five hundred dollars
($500.00).
   When the waste water treatment plant is discontinued and connection made to
a sanitary sewerage system of the City, any undistributed cash from the cash
bond shall be returned to the owner. (W.V. Ord. 47-69. Passed 12-9-69. )
1044.07 FAULTY OPERATION PROHIBITED.
   No person, being the owner of land upon which a waste water treatment plant
has been constructed in connection with the use of the property under the
provisions of this chapter, shall maintain or continue the operation of a plant
which is not operating in accordance with standards established by the Ohio
Environmental Protection Agency and adopted by this chapter.
(W.V. Ord. 47-69. Passed 12-9-69.)
 
1044.08 IMPROPER DISCHARGE PROHIBITED.
   No person shall discharge, or permit or cause to be discharged, sewage or
the overflow, drainage or contents of a waste water treatment plant onto the
surface of the ground or into any street, road, alley, storm sewer, drainage
ditch or watercourse except in the manner provided by the Ohio Environmental
Protection Agency.
(W.V. Ord. 47-69. Passed 12-9-69.)
1044.09 MANDATORY CONNECTION TO SEWERS WHEN AVAILABLE.
   No waste water treatment plant shall be installed and maintained on property
accessible to a sanitary sewer. Whenever a sanitary sewer is made available,
the treatment plant shall be abandoned and the sewage shall be discharged
directly from the building to the sanitary sewer without passage through the
treatment plant. The plant shall thereafter be dismantled in accordance with
regulations prescribed by the City Engineer.
(W.V. Ord. 47-69. Passed 12-9-69.)
1044.10 LICENSE REQUIRED.
   (a)   No person shall operate a waste water treatment plant within the City
without first obtaining the following:
      (1)   A waste water treatment plant operator's license from the State;
and
      (2)   An operator's license from the City. Such license shall be issued
by the City Engineer after an application has been completed on such forms as
are furnished by the City Engineer and approved by him.
         (Adopting Ordinance)
   (b)   Operators licensed by the State shall place on file with the City
Engineer a certified or photostatic copy of such license.
   (c)   Any operator who fails to maintain or repair a waste water treatment
plant within ten days after notice to maintain or repair as required by this
chapter shall forfeit his operator's license issued by the City. (W.V. Ord. 47-
69. Passed 12-9-69.)
1044.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates or fails to comply with any of the provisions of this
chapter shall be fined not more than five hundred dollars ($500.00) or
imprisoned not more than ninety days. A separate offense shall be deemed
committed each day during or on which a violation occurs or continues.
(W.V. Ord. 47-69. Passed 12-9-69. )

1060.01 DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter:
   (a)   “Garbage” means the animal and vegetable waste resulting from
handling, preparation, cooking or consumption of food.
   (b)   "Food” means and includes all substances used or intended to be used
for human consumption, including any item used or manufactured or sold for use
in food regardless of its actual use.
   (c)   “Alcoholic beverages” means any beverage or drink containing one
percent or more of alcohol by volume.
   (d)   "Rubbish"' means combustible and noncombustible waste materials,
except garbage.
   (e)   “Dwelling unit” has the meaning provided in Section
1204.03(44) of these Codified Ordinances, provided said dwelling unit has an
individual street address.
   (f)   “Apartment” has the meaning provided in Section
1204.03(38) of these Codified Ordinances.
   (g)   “Solid waste contractor” means the business association with which the
City has contracted to collect and dispose of solid waste.
   (h)   “Solid waste” means all garbage and rubbish which can legally be
disposed of in a standard residential rubbish and garbage storage facility.
   (i)   “User” means any person or dwelling unit receiving garbage and rubbish
collection and disposal services from the City’s solid waste contractor.
      (Ord. 100-2005. Passed 12-27-05.)
1060.02 STORAGE FACILITIES REQUIRED.
   (a)   No person shall own or occupy a dwelling unit unless such dwelling
unit is supplied with rubbish and garbage storage facilities adequate to
contain all of the rubbish and garbage stored on the premises in nonflammable,
substantially waterproof containers maintained in such condition so as not to
attract flies, rodents, insects or other animal life tending to create a health
hazard.
   (b)   All owners and/or occupants of single-family dwelling units shall
store all rubbish and garbage storage facilities in such a place or manner so
they are substantially screened from view from an adjoining street or curbside
(W.V. Ord. 13-70. Passed 2-24-70; Ord. 54-2019. Passed 9-10-19.)
  
1060.03 STORAGE IN OTHER THAN APPROVED FACILITIES PROHIBITED,
   No person shall store or cause to be stored any garbage or rubbish outside
of any dwelling unit except in an approved garbage and rubbish storage facility
as required by Section
1060.02. (W.V. Ord. 13-70. Passed 2-24-70.)
1060.04 COLLECTION REGULATIONS.
   (a)   No person shall place garbage or rubbish on a treelawn or at curbside
prior to 4 p.m. on the day before the regularly designated collection day for
the dwelling unit for which the garbage and rubbish is stored.
   (b)   No person shall place garbage or rubbish on a treelawn or at curbside
for collection except in an approved storage facility as designated in Section
1060.02.
   (c)   Notwithstanding subsection (b) hereof, large nonburnable items, boxes,
crates, newspapers, magazines, lumber, tree and hedge trimmings and other items
not suitable for placing in containers may be placed on a treelawn or at
curbside for collection. No item mentioned in this subsection shall be so
placed unless it is bundled or tied or otherwise arranged in a fashion
reasonably calculated to avoid danger to any person and to avoid littering any
property.
   (d)   No alcoholic beverage shall be stored outside of any dwelling unit
under any circumstances without an adult or other person legally authorized to
possess such a beverage being present and in control of such a beverage.
   (e)   All garbage and rubbish storage facilities shall be removed from the
treelawn or curbside within twenty-four hours following collection.
   (f)   Brush may be placed on a treelawn or curbside for monthly pick-up by
the City no sooner than five days prior to the first Monday of every month and
no later than 6:00 a.m. on such day. Brush placed so late as to miss the
regularly scheduled pick-up shall be removed from the treelawn or curbside,
stored in a sightly manner and placed for pick-up the following month.
(Ord. 93-95. Passed 11-28-95.)
1060.05 COLLECTION CREWS.
   (a)   No person shall operate a truck or other vehicle within the City
without accepting responsibility for the action of any member of the crew of
such truck or vehicle with regard to the collection of garbage and rubbish.
   (b)   No person shall, in the collection of garbage or rubbish, allow any
garbage or rubbish to fall on any street or on any private property within the
City without immediately collecting such garbage and rubbish and placing it in
the garbage and rubbish truck or vehicle. (W.V. Ord. 13-70. Passed 2-24-70.)
1060.06 SCAVENGERS.
   No person shall, unless authorized by Council, collect any items of rubbish
or garbage within the City nor remove any item of garbage or rubbish from a
garbage or rubbish storage facility other than his own.
(W.V. Ord. 13-70. Passed 2-24-70.)
1060.07 COMPOST.
   Notwithstanding any other section of this chapter, this chapter shall not
apply to a compost pile properly compacted, covered and chemically treated in a
manner which does not attract insects, vermin or animals and which does not
otherwise constitute a hazard to the health or safety of the residents of the
City.
(W.V. Ord. 13-70. Passed 2-24-70.)
1060.08 ENFORCEMENT.
   (a)   The Mayor, the Building and Zoning Inspector, the Police Department
and any other person or department designated by Council for such purpose are
hereby charged with the enforcement of this chapter.
   (b)   Those persons charged with the enforcement of this chapter shall have
the same power to make arrests and to issue citations as is by ordinance or
other law conferred upon the Police Department in all cases where any person
violates any of the provisions of this chapter. (W.V. Ord. 13-70. Passed 2-24-
70.)
1060.09 PRIVATE COLLECTION.
   All apartments, businesses and commercial premises, shall be required to
contract on their own for the removal of garbage and rubbish from such
premises. The date for pickup shall be consistent with the City-wide selected
day.
(Ord. 79-2002. Passed 6-25-02.)
1060.10 CHARGES.
   (a)   For solid waste collection and disposal, the City shall charge to each
dwelling unit within the Municipality a monthly rate to be paid by the owner of
said property. Such rate shall be as established from time to time by Council.
   (b)   If "tipping” fees or other additional environmental fees are charged
to the City by other governmental entities or agencies or the City's solid
waste contractor, such additional fees shall be added to and prorated among
thedwelling units in existence at that time and be made a part of the fee
charged by the City as set forth in subsection (a) hereof.
   (c)   If a commercial use on real property upon which a dwelling unit is
located requires more than a standard residential rubbish and garbage storage
facility to be utilized, the user shall pay only the cost of the commercial
storage facility, provided the user utilizes the services of the City’s solid
waste contractor, unless the property owner requests both a commercial and
residential storage facility be provided. If the user utilizes the services of
any other solid waste contractor, the user shall be required to pay the charges
specified in paragraphs (a) and (b), above, in addition to the commercial
charges.
   (d) At the time of conveyance of title to any real property within the City
upon which is situated one or more dwelling units, all outstanding charges for
solid waste collection and disposal shall be paid by the owner of said real
property prior to transfer of title.
   (e)    The billing for the rates established hereinabove shall be made by
the City's solid waste contractor on a quarterly basis. If the City receives
notice from its solid waste contractor that an owner of real property upon
which a dwelling unit is located has failed to pay the fee assessed for a
period of at least ninety days, then the City shall notify said owner (as
contained in the County real property records), via regular United States mail,
that his or her bill is overdue and that a twenty percent City administrative
fee has been added to the bill to cover the cost of collection. The owner shall
be further advised that unless the overdue bill, including the administrative
fee, has been paid to the City within thirty days of the date of the letter,
then further action will be taken by the City.
   (f)    Any owner who fails to pay the fee assessed herein for a period of
more than the thirty days provided for in subsection (d) hereof will be sent a
second notice of said delinquency, which shall be sent by United States
certified mail, postage prepaid. If the owner has not paid the entire fee due
within fourteen days of receipt of the second letter, then the City shall refer
the matter to either the Director of Law or the City Prosecutor for collection
as other debts of like amount are recoverable, or for prosecution as set forth
herein below. In the event that the certified mailing authorized herein is
either refused or unclaimed by the owner, then the City shall mail the second
letter of delinquency by regular United States mail and the fourteen day time
period established herein shall commence on the date of such mailing. At any
time any delinquent fees for the City trash collection, plus penalties, and
administrative fees may be certified to the County Auditor and Treasurer as due
and payable from the property owner and upon such certification shall be
collected in the same manner as other City taxes and/or fees upon the tax
duplicate as allowed by law.
   The Director of Finance shall, on an annual basis, or as needed, furnish to
the County Auditor and Treasurer such other and further information as is
necessary to permit identification of the property against which the aforesaid
fee has been assessed and which remains unpaid.
   (g)   Any owner of real property upon which a dwelling unit is located who
fails to pay the fee established herein to the City for a period of more than
fourteen days after receiving the notice of delinquency authorized in
subsection (f) hereof shall, in addition to any other charges, be subject to
the penalty provided in Section
1060.99.
   (h)   Any owner of a dwelling unit approved by the office of the County
Auditor for the homestead exemption may petition the City for exemption from
the fees assessed pursuant to this section. (Ord. 100-2005. Passed 12-27-05.)
1060.11 SOLID WASTE COLLECTION FEE.
   (a)   For solid waste collection and disposal, the City shall charge to each
dwelling unit within the Municipality a monthly rate to be paid by the owner of
said property. Such rate shall be set by Council by Resolution each year. The
Council shall review the monthly rate to be paid by the owner(s) of a
residential dwelling within the municipality on a yearly basis to determine the
amount of the fee for the ensuing year.
   (b)   A dwelling unit is defined in Section
1204.03(44) of these Codified Ordinances.
   (c)   At the direction of Council by Resolution, the City may assess the
costs and expense of solid waste collection within the City, on each dwelling
unit defined in subsection (b) herein, by certifying the amounts to the County
Fiscal Officer for collection with other City taxes.
   (d)   The waste collection fee so assessed through the residential tax
duplicate shall be reimbursed to the City by the County Fiscal Officer, and
shall be credited to the City of Olmsted Falls.
   (e)   The Finance Director is hereby authorized and directed to send to the
Office of the County Fiscal Officer certified copies of this Ordinance in such
numbers as are required.
(Ord. 100-2013. Passed 10-22-13.)
1060.99 PENALTY.
   (a)   Whoever violates any of the provisions of this chapter, for which no
penalty is otherwise provided, shall be fined not more than one hundred dollars
($100.00). A separate offense shall be deemed committed each day during or on
which a violation occurs or continues. (Adopting Ordinance)
   (b)   Whoever violates Section
1060.10(f) shall be guilty of a minor misdemeanor for a first offense and shall
be fined not more than one hundred dollars ($100.00). For any subsequent
offense, such person shall be guilty of a misdemeanor of the fourth degree and
shall be fined not more than two hundred and fifty dollars ($250.00) or
imprisoned not more than thirty days, or both.
(Ord. 68-93. Passed 11-9-93.)
CHAPTER 1062
Parks
1062.01   Hours.
1062.02   Animals and pets prohibited.
1062.03   Sleeping; peace disturbances.
1062.04   Fishing.
1062.05   Camping and use of motor vehicles.
1062.06   Weapons.

1062.08   Motor vehicles.
1062.09   Fireworks and explosives.
1062.10   Games of chance.
1062.11   Injuring wildlife.
1062.12   Alcoholic beverages.
1062.13   Vandalism.
1062.14   Vegetation and property.
1062.15   Littering and dumping.
1062.16   Indecent exposure.
1062.17   Designation of Allan R. Mills Park; use of baseball field.
1062.18   Swimming in Rocky River and Plum Creek.
1062.99   Penalty.

Parks and Recreation Board - see CHTR. Sec.
 10.03

612.09

1064 
 
 
1062.01 HOURS.
   The Municipal parks of the City with adequate lighting, namely Village
Green, shall be open to the public between the hours of 6:00 a.m. and 10:00
p.m. each day. All other parks shall close one-half hour after sunset. No
person shall enter or remain in such parks prior to their opening or subsequent
to their closing, except as provided in Section
1062.05 or by special permission granted by the Mayor. (Ord. 42-2008. Passed 6-
10-08.)
1062.02 ANIMALS AND PETS PROHIBITED.
   (a)   For the purpose of this section, a pet is defined as a tame animal
kept as a companion or for fun, and affectionately cared for.
   (b)   No pet shall be permitted within the confines of the Municipal parks,
unless such pet is on a leash or is confined in an open-air enclosure
sufficient to prevent such pet from running at large. (Ord. 56-91. Passed 7-1-
91.)
1062.03 SLEEPING; PEACE DISTURBANCES.
   Sleeping or protracted lounging; loud, boisterous, threatening, profane,
insulting or indecent language; disorderly or indecent conduct or behavior; and
any acts tending to be a breach of the public peace are prohibited in the
Municipa1 parks.
(O.F. Ord. 579. Passed 6-24-40.)
1062.04 FISHING.
   No person shall fish in the Municipal parks at any time except during the
fixed season established by the laws of the State. No person shall fish in a
pool or from the dam at any time during the season such pool is in use.
(O.F. Ord. 579. Passed 6-24-40.)
1062.05 CAMPING AND USE OF MOTOR VEHICLES.
   (a)   Overnight camping and the use of motor vehicles in the Municipal parks
are permitted only upon procuring a license from the officer in charge of the
park.
   (b)   The license fee for overnight camping shall be two dollars ($2.00) for
each night. The license for the use of motor vehicles in the parks shall be
granted without charge.
1062.06 WEAPONS.
   No firearms, air guns, slingshots, bows and arrows or any devices for the
throwing of missiles shall be transported to or carried in the Municipal parks,
except such arms as may be carried by duly appointed officers of law.
(O.F. Ord. 579. Passed 6-24-40.)
1062.07 HUNTING AND TRAPPING.
   No person shall hunt or trap any animal or bird in the Municipal parks.
(O.F. Ord. 579. Passed 6-24-40.)
1062.08 MOTOR VEHICLES.
   No person shall drive or park a vehicle in the Municipal parks, except upon
driveways and in parking lots provided for the general public.
(Ord. 53-84. Passed 3-26-84.)
1062.09 FIREWORKS AND EXPLOSIVES.
   No fireworks, caps, torpedos or explosives of any kind shall be permitted in
the Municipal parks. (O.F. Ord. 579. Passed 6-24-40.)
1062.10 GAMES OF CHANCE.
   No game of chance of any kind whatsoever shall be permitted in the Municipal
parks, unless such game of chance is conducted so as to benefit a non-profit
organization.
(Ord. 81-99. Passed 10-26-99.)
1062.11 INJURING WILDLIFE.
   No person shall use any weapon, stick, stone or missile of any kind to the
destruction or injury of, or in any way to disturb or molest, any wild anima1
or bird within the Municipal parks.
(O.F. Ord. 579. Passed 6-24-40.)
1062.12 ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES.
   No person shall transport into or use within the confines of the Municipal
parks any alcoholic beverage of any kind, including beer, wine and intoxicating
liquor.
(O.F. Ord. 579. Passed 6-24-40.)
1062.13 VANDALISM.
   No person shall remove, destroy, break, injure, write upon, mutilate or
degrade any structure, monument, statue, vase, fountain, wall, vehicle, flower,
shrub, tree or other property within the Municipal parks.
(O.F. Ord. 579. Passed 6-24-40.)
1062.14 VEGETATION AND PROPERTY.
   No person shall remove, reform or renovate, or so attempt, any vegetation or
property, whether natural or man-made, which is contained in any of the parks
in the City, without written permmsion from the Parks and Recreation Board.
   Any enhancement or beautification shall be done only in areas set forth on a
map prepared by the Parks and Recreation Board, which is kept on file at City
Hall.
(Ord. 77-91. Passed 8-14-91.)
1062.15 LITTERING AND DUMPING.
   No person shall dump any rubbish or waste of any kind in the Municipal
parks, nor, after using the parks for picnic purposes or for any other purpose,
leave any rubbish, waste, bottles, cans or litter, but shall place the same
within containers designated by the City as containers for such rubbish and
waste.
(O.F. Ord. 579. Passed 6-24-40.)
1062.16 INDECENT EXPOSURE.
   No person shall appear in the Municipal parks, or bathe, wade or conduct
himself therein, in a naked state or with his or her person so much
underdressed that there is an indecent exposure of the body publicly or where
he or she may be publicly seen.
(O.F. Ord. 579. Passed 6-24-40.)
1062.17 DESIGNATION OF ALLAN R. MILLS PARK; USE OF BASEBALL FIELD.
   (a)   The parcel of land presently known as the Southwest Memorial Park is
hereby designated and named for all purposes from this time forward as the
Allan R. Mills Park.
   (b)   The Mayor is hereby authorized to take all steps necessary to
effectuate the necessary change of the name of such Park on any signs presently
existing and containing the name of such Park.
   (c)   The Mayor is hereby authorized to conduct all ceremonies which the
Mayor, together with the members of the Parks and Recreation Board, deems
necessary or appropriate to properly change the name of such Park and designate
and dedicate it as the Allan R. Mills Park.
   (d)   The baseball field located at the Park shall be limited in use to the
following:
      (1)   The major girls league (ages thirteen to sixteen, and under) and
intermediate boys league (ages nine and ten, and under) of the Olmsted summer
league and the teams of the minor hot stove league;
      (2)   Girls under the age of seventeen and boys under the age of eleven,
provided that they bat the ball only from the designated home plate; and
      (3)   Girls seventeen years of age and older and boys eleven years of age
and older, provided they are accompanied by a responsible adult and further
provided they bat the ball only from the designated home plate.
         (Ord. 66-98. Passed 6-23-98.)
      
1062.18 SWIMMING IN ROCKY RIVER AND PLUM CREEK.
   (a)   Swimming, wading, bathing or other similar conduct within the Rocky
River and Plum Creek, in and around River Park, is hereby prohibited as being
unsafe and dangerous conduct. However, the provisions herein prohibiting wading
shall not apply to licensed fishermen who are wading for purposes of fishing.
   (b)   The Service Director is hereby authorized and instructed to post signs
on all such public property prohibiting such activity within Rocky River and
Plum Creek.
(Ord. 90-84. Passed 6-25-84.)
1062.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any of the provisions of this chapter shall be fined not
more than one hundred dollars ($100.00).
(O.F. Ord. 579. Passed 6-24-40.)
CHAPTER 1064
Recreation Programs
1064.01    Fees.
1064.02    Records
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Parks and Recreation Board - see CHTR. Sec.
10.03
Park and Recreation Trust Fund - see ADM.
234.05(b)
Use of streets for recreational activities - see TRAF.
412.02
Parks - see S.U. & P.S. Ch.
1062
Park and recreation development fees - see B. & H. 1448.035
 
 
1064.01 FEES.
   A fee shall be charged to participants enrolling in organized team or other
recreation programs sponsored by the City which incur costs such as
timekeepers, scorekeepers, sports equipment and related supplies. The Parks and
Recreation Board shall determine the amount of the fee for each such program,
which may be established for teams, for individuals or for both teams and
individuals, and which shall be greater for nonresidents than for residents. As
used in this section, "resident" means an individual who resides within the
City limits. Further, the Board shall base such determination upon:
   (a)   The total cost of the sports officials, sports equipment and related
supplies of each such program; and
   (b)   A proportionate cost of the administration of each such program by the
Recreation Director and his assistants and the maintenance of the facilities
required for each such program by the Service Department.
      (Ord. 53-2011. Passed 5-24-11.)
1064.02 RECORDS.
   The Clerk of Council shall keep a record for the Parks and Recreation Board
of all application forms and team registration.
(Ord. 28-74. Passed 4-9-74)
CHAPTER 1066
Cemeteries
   EDITOR'S NOTE: A union cemetery between the former Villages of West View and
Olmsted Falls and the Board of Trustees of Olmsted Township was established by
West View Resolution 54, passed April 15, 1929, and Olmsted Falls Resolution
214, passed April 22, 1929.
   Resolution 22-2000, passed April 25, 2000, reaffirmed the City's
participation in the Union Cemetery Association.
1066.01   Injuring vegetation; use of vehicles.
1066.02   Injuring gravestones, fences, etc.
1066.03   Fires; picnics; disorderly conduct.
1066.04   Automobiles.
1066.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Burials may be prohibited - see Ohio R.C. 759.05
Management and control - see Ohio R.C. 759.09
Union cemeteries - see Ohio R.C. 759.27 et seq.
Burial permits - see Ohio R.C. 3705.24 et seq.
Burial of indigent persons - see Ohio R.C. 5113.15
 
 
1066.01 INJURING VEGETATION; USE OF VEHICLES.
   No person shall remove, alter, damage, pick or destroy any tree, shrub, wild
flower or plant growing in Chestnut Grove Cemetery nor shall any person drive
upon the grass in such Cemetery with horse-drawn or gasoline propelled vehicles
except for hearses at the time of burial and except for any such vehicles used
by the proper officials in the maintenance of the Cemetery. (O.F. Ord. 649.
Passed 5-18-42.)
1066.02 INJURING GRAVESTONES, FENCES, ETC.
   No person shall injure, remove, mar or destroy any tomb, monument,
gravestone, gravemarker or other marker or any fence, railing, seat or other
works in and about the Cemetery. (O.F. Ord. 649. Passed 5-18-42.)
1066.03 FIRES; PICNICS; DISORDERLY CONDUCT.
   Except where necessary for the proper maintenance of the Cemetery, no person
shall build any fire or start any fire in the Cemetery nor shall picnicking or
gatherings where refreshments are served be conducted in the Cemetery nor shall
any person make loud boisterous noises or conduct himself in a disorderly
manner in the Cemetery.
(O.F. Ord. 649. Passed 5-18-42.)
1066.04 AUTOMOBILES.
   Except where necessary for proper cemetery maintenance and upon the occasion
of funerals or in special instances where permission is granted by the officer
or sexton of the Cemetery, no person shall drive a vehicle in Chestnut Grove
Cemetery, except upon driveways provided for the general public. (Ord. 54-84.
Passed 3-26-84.)
1066.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any of the provisions of this chapter shall be fined not
more than one hundred dollars ($100.00).
CHAPTER 1068
Use of City Personnel and Equipment
1068.01    Schedule of charges generally.    
1068.02    Charges for cutting weeds.

1068.01 SCHEDULE OF CHARGES GENERALLY.
   Whenever it is necessary for the City to use City personnel and City
equipment as a result of the negligent act of a third party, including the
repairing or restoring of City property therefor, the City shall charge for any
and all labor performed therefor by City personnel and any and all City
equipment used therefor according to the following schedule:
   (a)   Labor performed and equipment used during normal City working hours
other than fire equipment or labor:
 
Labor Performed by City Personnel City Equipment Used
$35.00 per hour, one hour minimum $75.00 per hour per each piece of City
                                  equipment used with one hour minimum
 
   (b)   Labor performed and equipment used during other than normal City
working hours:
 
Labor Performed by City Personnel  City Equipment Used
$52.50 per hour, three hour minimum  $75.00 per hour per each piece of City
                                     equipment used with one hour minimum
 
   (c)   For purposes of this section, the normal City working hours are Monday
through Friday, from 7:30 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.
   (d)   Except as otherwise provided in Chapter
626 of these Codified Ordinances, fire equipment used and fire personnel used
at any time:
 
Labor Performed by City Personnel City Equipment Used
                                  A minimum of $100.00 to move any fire truck
$27.50 per hour                   from the fire station and an additional
                                  $25.00 per hour for the use of any such fire
                                  truck
 
In addition, the actual cost of any other supplies or non-City owned equipment
required to be used shall be charged. (Ord. 6-93. Passed 2-23-93.)
1068.02 CHARGES FOR CUTTING WEEDS.
   In the case of a violation of Section
660.21 (Weeds) or Chapter
1474 of the Codified Ordinances regarding weeds, lawns, and such exterior
portions of property, the violation thereof hereby being declared to be a
public nuisance, and which violation causes the use of City personnel and City
equipment to abate any such nuisance as provided therein, the labor performed
by the City personnel and the equipment used therefor shall be charged
according to the following rates:
   (a)   The charge for the use of City personnel and City equipment to perform
the necessary mowing functions shall be as set forth in Section
1068.01 for the use of City equipment and City personnel.
   (b)   Should it be necessary to prepare any such property to bring it to a
mowable condition, (at which point the rate in subsection (a) hereof would
become applicable) the rates for City personnel and City equipment shall be as
specified in Section
1068.01.
      (Ord. 80-2002. Passed 6-25-02.)
CHAPTER 1070
Jenkins Center
1070.01   Designation.
1070.02   Director of Senior Citizen Activities.
1070.03   Authority of Parks and Recreation Board.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Parks and Recreation Board - see ADM. Ch.
260
Parks - see S.U. & P.S. Ch.
1062
Recreation - see S.U. & P.S. Ch.
1064
 
 
1070.01 DESIGNATION.
   (a)   As a lasting tribute to the unending and energetic efforts of Edgar M.
Jenkins (Bill Jenkins) to the civic activities of the community, the Community/
Senior Center is hereby designated and named the Jenkins Center, and the proper
City employees are hereby authorized to order the necessary signs and
designations to identify the Community/Senior Center as the Jenkins Center.
   (b)   The Mayor is hereby authorized to implement the naming of the
Community/Senior Center as the Jenkins Center at any ceremony which he deems
appropriate.
(Ord. 29-81. Passed 4-13-81.)
1070.02 DIRECTOR OF SENIOR CITIZEN ACTIVITIES.
   (a)   The position previously known as the Director of Golden Age Activities
is hereby changed, in name only, to the Director of Senior Citizen Activities.
   (b)   The duties of such office are to continue as previously established,
which are to perform any act or to do any thing proper to advance the
activities and the well being of the senior citizens of the City, under the
direction of the administration of the City.
(Ord. 3-84. Passed 1-9-84.)
   (c)   The Director shall receive such compensation as determined from time
to time by Council.
1070.03 AUTHORITY OF PARKS AND RECREATION BOARD.
   (a)   Pursuant to Section
10.02(4) of the City Charter, the coordination and responsibility for the
activities of the Jenkins Center are hereby placed under the control of the
Parks and Recreation Board, which control is to be exercised within the
guidelines of the Center being used predominantly for the senior citizens of
the City between the hours of 10:00 a. m. and 4:00 p. m. daily and that
priority be given to senior citizen activities at all other times where
possible.

CHAPTER 1202
Purpose and Interpretation
   EDITOR'S NOTE: Ordinance 24-97, passed October 14, 1997, repealed all of
Part Twelve of the Codified Ordinances (the Planning and Zoning Code of the
City) and adopted an entirely new Planning and Zoning Code.
1202.01    Title.
1202.02    Jurisdiction.
1202.03    Purpose and objectives.
1202.04    Interpretation and application.
1202.05    Conflicting laws.
1202.06    Separability.
1202.07    General applicability of useregulations.
1202.08    Effective date.
1202.09    Computation of time.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Division of municipal corporation into zones - see Ohio R.C. 713.06
Restrictions on location, bulk and height of buildings and structures,
percentage of lot occupancy and set-back building lines - see Ohio R.C. 713.07
et seq.
Basis of districting or zoning; classification of buildings or structures - see
Ohio R.C. 713.10
Notice and hearing on municipal zoning regulations - see Ohio R.C. 713.12
Effect of zoning on laws and charters - see Ohio R.C. 713.14
Retroactive zoning ordinances prohibited - see Ohio R.C. 713.15
 
 
1202.01 TITLE.
   These rules, regulations, procedures, and accompanying maps shall be known,
cited, and referred to as the Olmsted Falls Planning and Zoning Code. This Code
includes standards for planning, subdividing, and developing land within the
City, as set forth in the Subdivision Regulations and the Zoning Code.
(Ord. 24-97. Passed 10-14-97.)
1202.02 JURISDICTION.
   This Planning and Zoning Code shall be applicable to all land within the
City and to all other territory over which the City may now or in the future
have authority to make and enforce plans, plats, and regulations under Ohio
R.C. Chapter 711 or any similar law.
(Ord. 24-97. Passed 10-14-97.)
1202.03 PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES.
   (a)   The purpose of this Planning and Zoning Code is to promote the public
health and safety, and the convenience, comfort, prosperity, and/or general
welfare of the inhabitants of the City by regulating the use of buildings,
other structures, and land for residential, office, commercial, industrial,
institutional, public, or other uses; to establish zoning districts of such
classification and dimension as may be considered best to implement
comprehensive planning; to regulate the subdividing and development of land by
restricting the location, bulk, height, design, and land coverage of uses,
buildings, and structures; to limit the density of population; and to provide
regulations and procedures for the administration, interpretation, amendment,
and enforcement of the Planning and Zoning Code.
   (b)   This Planning and Zoning Code is established to achieve the following
objectives:
      (1)   To protect the character and the values of the residential,
business, industrial, and recreational areas, and to assure their orderly and
beneficial development;
      (2)   To provide for the reservation and dedication of land for safe and
convenient pedestrian and vehicular circulation, and for open space for
recreation and other public purposes;
      (3)   To provide for the construction of streets and utilities which will
be adequate and economical to maintain;
      (4)   To ensure the accurate surveying of land and preparing and
recording of plats; and
      (5)   To provide for the coordination of land development with the
objectives of this Planning and Zoning Code and the Comprehensive Plan.
         (Ord. 24-97. Passed 10-14-97.)
1202.04 INTERPRETATION AND APPLICATION.
   In interpreting and applying the provisions of this Planning and Zoning
Code, they shall be held to be minimum requirements adopted for the promotion
of the public health, safety, convenience, comfort, prosperity, and general
welfare. They shall be liberally construed to further the purposes and
objectives set forth herein and the purposes and intent of each district as set
forth in each district chapter.
   (a)   They shall apply uniformly to each class or kind of use, building,
structure, or land.
   (b)   This Planning and Zoning Code shall not interfere with, abrogate, or
annul any easement, covenant, deed or plat restrictions, or other agreement
between parties, except that in cases where this Planning and Zoning Code
imposes a greater restriction upon the use of buildings or premises, upon the
height of buildings, or upon the lot area per family, or requires larger yards
or other open spaces, than are imposed or required by such easements,
covenants, or agreements, the provisions of this Planning and Zoning Code shall
control.
   (c)   If there is uncertainty as to the meaning and intent of any of the
provisions of this Planning and Zoning Code, a request for an interpretation of
such provision by the Planning Commission may be made by any property owner or
by any officer, department, division, board, or bureau of the City.
      (Ord. 24-97. Passed 10-14-97.)
1202.05 CONFLICTING LAWS.
   This Planning and Zoning Code shall not repeal, abrogate, annul, or in any
way impair or interfere with any existing law or ordinance, or any rules or
regulations heretofore or hereafter adopted or promulgated pursuant to law
regulating the use of land or buildings except to the extent that this Planning
and Zoning Code imposes a greater restriction upon the use of buildings or
premises, upon the height of buildings, or upon the lot area per family, or
requires larger yards or other open spaces, than are imposed or required by
such other laws, ordinances, or rules and regulations, in which case the more
restrictive provision of this Planning and Zoning Code shall control.
(Ord. 24-97. Passed 10-14-97.)
1202.06 SEPARABILITY.
   Should any provision of the regulations set forth in this Planning and
Zoning Code be declared invalid for a particular provision by a court of
competent jurisdiction, such decision shall not affect the validity of this
Planning and Zoning Code other than the provision declared to be invalid, nor
shall such decision affect the application of the particular provision to
different facts or circumstances.
(Ord. 24-97. Passed 10-14-97.)
1202.07 GENERAL APPLICABILITY OF USE REGULATIONS.
   Except to the extent expressly permitted by this Planning and Zoning Code,
after the effective date of this Code:
   (a)   No land or structure shall be used or occupied, and no structure shall
be erected, constructed, reconstructed, enlarged, moved, or structurally
altered, except in conformity with all of the regulations herein specified as
being applicable to such land or structure.
   (b)   No building shall accommodate or house a greater number of families or
employees than permitted by this Code.
   (c)   Any parcel of land may be divided into two or more zoning lots,
provided all lots resulting from such division shall conform to all lot area,
width, and depth regulations of the district in which it is located, and shall
comply with the procedures for minor or major subdivisions enumerated in
Chapter
1224.
   (d)   Any lot of record, whether vacant or occupied by a building, which has
an area, width, or depth equal to or less than required by these regulations,
and which was owned separately from adjoining lots on the effective date of
this Planning and Zoning Code or an amendment thereto, causing the lot to
become nonconforming, shall not be further reduced in any manner except by
conveyance of all or part of such lot to an adjacent owner or owners.
   (e)   Any part of a lot necessary to provide the required lot area for a
building or use shall not be considered as providing any part of the required
lot area for another building or use.
   (f)   No part of a yard, or other open space, or off-street parking area,
which may be required in this Code in connection with any land or structure,
shall be included as part of a yard, open space, or off-street parking or
loading space similarly required for any other land or structure.
   (g)   No yard or lot existing upon the effective date of this Code shall be
reduced in dimension or area below the minimum requirements set forth herein.
Yards or lots created after the effective date of this Planning and Zoning Code
shall meet the minimum requirements herein established.
      (Ord. 24-97. Passed 10-14-97.)
1202.08 EFFECTIVE DATE.
   This Planning and Zoning Code shall take effect and be in full force from
and after its passage, or at the earliest period allowed by law.
(Ord. 24-97. Passed 10-14-97.)
1202.09 COMPUTATION OF TIME.
   (a)   Unless otherwise specifically provided, the time within which an act
is to be done shall be computed by excluding the first and including the last
day. If the last day is a Saturday, Sunday, or legal holiday, that day shall be
excluded. When the period of time prescribed is less than seven days,
intermediate Saturdays, Sundays, and holidays shall be excluded.
   (b)   Unless otherwise specifically provided, whenever a person has the
right or is required to do some act within a prescribed period after the
service of a notice or other paper upon him or her and the notice or paper is
served by mail, three days shall be added to the prescribed period.
(Ord. 24-97. Passed 10-14-97.)
